metadata.synopsis: Filmmaker Ben Burtt shows how special effects are used in movies like "King Kong," "Independence Day," "Jumanji." John Lithgow narrates.

reviews: Every sequence is like a rough sketch for a film Larry Cohen would do properly if he had the time and the money. But what great ideas he has!
It is as if Cohen had a list of ideas he wanted to incorporate, but no real sense of how to articulate them, so they all wind up in a big, messy stew.
An uneven homage spoof on auteurs like Hitchcock, Powell and Ferrara.
A significant (if ultimately chaotic) entry in the director's canon of ramshackle tributes to the dark, dangerous, voyeuristic allure of the cinema.
Coherence is not the strong point here.
